da299b5d-d640-4cd0-bcec-9679c3a1efd2.description: Resilience in the 21st century includes the capacity to bounce back in the face of stress, challenge, and adversity. They do not dwell on disappointment but rather learn from experience and focus on solutions. Resilient individuals exhibit four core sub-competencies: self-awareness, exhibit flexibility, learn from experience, and focus on solutions.
da299b5d-d640-4cd0-bcec-9679c3a1efd2.name: Resilience - Community College of Vermont

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has spent 10-15 hours of time on the content, and has demonstrated mastery on the four associated sub-competencies.
The recipient of this badge has successfully applied their resilience skills, and the associated sub-competencies in a professional environment.
The recipient of this badge has exhibited their resilience skills through a series of performance-based assessments grounded in workplace scenarios.

54e03325-f4d4-4424-a0c0-1983645ce91b.description: Earners of this badge are able to build a variety of spreadsheets using simple and complex formulas, functions, graphics, database features, sorts, linkages within spreadsheets and between spreadsheets, and macros.
54e03325-f4d4-4424-a0c0-1983645ce91b.name: Spreadsheets

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics include spreadsheets basics, cloud file management, formatting and efficiency tools, conditional formatting, in-cell graphing, advanced functions, tables and ranges, forms, formula auditing, working between sheets and books, charts and graphs, maps, data integrity, subtotals, validations, working across worksheets and workbooks, excel forms, hyperlinks and office integration, pivot tables, what if analysis, and data security.
Apply knowledge of spreadsheets concepts through a series of quizzes.

Develop 6 projects that apply knowledge of spreadsheets to a real-world scenario. Topics include functions and sparklines, essential skills, data visualization, creating a Google Map from a spreadsheet, Excel 2D or 3D map, and advanced functions.

bc89f06d-31bc-4e1c-acdb-32133cb1023c.description: Earners of this badge are able to use prefixes, word roots, combining forms, and suffixes to translate the meaning of medical terms. They are also able to define, spell, pronounce, and employ a fundamental vocabulary of medical terms and abbreviations; correlate medical terms with body systems and anatomic structures; use suffixes to determine the clinical category of medical terms; convert medical terms to and from abbreviations; and understand quantitative literacy as used in healthcare.
bc89f06d-31bc-4e1c-acdb-32133cb1023c.name: Medical Terminology

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics studied are body structure, directional terms, positioning, imaging, oncology, laboratory tests, and body systems, including integumentary, respiratory, urinary, male reproductive, female reproductive, obstetrics and neonatology, cardiovascular, immune, lymphatic, digestive, special senses (eye and ear), musculoskeletal, nervous, and endocrine.

Demonstrate the ability to use a medical dictionary and the ability to determine if online information sources are reliable in discussion posts and culminating presentation of a case study and web report.
Demonstrate the ability to correctly pronounce medical terms in a series of audio exercises.
Apply knowledge of medical terminology through a series of quizzes and exams.
Demonstrate the use of medical terms in context in a variety of writing assignments, including discussion posts, learning journals, and a case study written by the student.

c6b8c8c7-1873-4fae-a2e9-56e3d000ad4b.description: Earners of this badge are able to apply techniques of internet marketing to attract, convert, and retain customers through the creation of an original digital marketing plan. Topics covered include search marketing, display advertising, email marketing, site optimization, social media, mobile marketing, and online analytics.
c6b8c8c7-1873-4fae-a2e9-56e3d000ad4b.name: Introduction to Digital Marketing

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 13 modules. Topics include SMART goals, target market, consumer data & analytics, product performance, user experience (UX), website design, SEO, social media advertising & platforms, B2B & B2C marketing, content marketing strategy, and direct to consumer marketing.
Apply knowledge of digital marketing terms and concepts through a series of quizzes and exams.
Create an original 6-8 page digital marketing plan including executive summary, current marketing situation, SWOT analysis, goals, strategy, tactics, budgets, and measurements.

e573ffc4-d531-4744-826f-9960b6d69c08.description: Earners of this badge are able to apply knowledge of accounting principles and computer applications to operate integrated accounting software for various aspects of accounting: general ledger, accounts payable and receivable, payroll, and depreciation.
e573ffc4-d531-4744-826f-9960b6d69c08.name: Computerized Accounting

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 11 modules. Topics include accounting basics, chart of accounts, Excel as an accounting system, bank reconciliation, accounts receivable, accounts payable, internal controls, payroll, journal entries, reports in Excel, generating reports in QuickBooks Online, and exploring other accounting software applications and platforms.
Apply knowledge of computerized accounting concepts through a series of quizzes.
Complete a bookkeeping project by setting up a chart of accounts, enter A/R and A/P transactions, compute and enter adjusting entries, and generate reports.

c16e9898-758d-4322-b5c0-f9dbc621cfe1.description: Empathy in the 21st century includes the capacity to understand others' perspectives and feelings to improve the quality of relationships, behaviors and performance. Empathetic individuals exhibit core four sub-competencies: "read the room": they listen actively, to what is said explicitly and nonverbally. They are able to recognize what others need and to validate the feelings and of colleagues, recognizing that validation is not the same as agreement, and to incorporate diverse perspectives.
c16e9898-758d-4322-b5c0-f9dbc621cfe1.name: Empathy - Community College of Vermont

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has a strong understanding of empathy and its applications in the workplace.
The recipient of this badge has successfully applied their empathy skills, and the associated sub-competencies in a professional environment.
The recipient of this badge has exhibited their empathy skills through a series of performance-based assessments grounded in workplace scenarios.

160d10b6-ad84-4590-a4ab-683a1663acf7.description: Intercultural fluency in the 21st century includes the capacity to operate and communicate in different cultural contexts. Individuals who are fluent interculturally exhibit these core four sub-competencies: recognize and challenge their own cultural biases; show curiosity; demonstrate self-awareness; and incorporate diverse perspectives.
160d10b6-ad84-4590-a4ab-683a1663acf7.name: Intercultural Fluency - Community College of Vermont

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has a strong understanding of intercultural fluency and its applications in the workplace.
The recipient of this badge has successfully applied their intercultural fluency skills, and the associated sub-competencies in a professional environment.
The recipient of this badge has exhibited their intercultural fluency skills through a series of performance-based assessments grounded in workplace scenarios.

3cece9b9-ae96-4818-8b58-aaabcb7704b4.description: Oral communication in the 21st century includes verbal and nonverbal communication. An effective oral communicator can speak with clarity and precision in formal and informal contexts. Effective communicators exhibit four core sub-competencies: use stories to communicate ideas; they are aware of their audience and use the appropriate tone and word choice. They are also active listeners who can "hear" both what is said and what is not said and can use body language effectively.
3cece9b9-ae96-4818-8b58-aaabcb7704b4.name: Oral Communication - Community College of Vermont

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has a strong understanding of oral communication and its applications in the workplace.
The recipient of this badge has successfully applied their oral communication skills, and the associated sub-competencies in a professional environment.
The recipient of this badge has exhibited their oral communication skills through a series of performance-based assessments grounded in workplace scenarios.

skills.name: Use Appropriate Tone And Word Choice

6a698767-17a7-41a4-bffd-9db6a6b45f01.description: Collaboration in the 21st century includes the capacity to work productively with different individuals and groups toward a common goal. Effective collaborators strengthen relationships by incorporating diverse perspectives, using active listening skills, and focusing on solutions rather than problems. View this badge in the credential registry: https://credentialengine.org/publisher/credential/9851/Collaboration_21st_Century_Skills_Badge
6a698767-17a7-41a4-bffd-9db6a6b45f01.name: Collaboration - Community College of Vermont

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has gone through a conflict mode instrument assessment identifying their style for handling conflict.
The recipient of this badge has a strong understanding of what it means to be a successful collaborator in the workplace.
The recipient of this badge has successfully applied their collaboration skills in a professional environment.

ba435d4c-ae8e-41ae-8ef7-198ae98804e1.description: Initiative in the 21st century includes self-efficacy and the capacity to identify needs and respond proactively. Individuals who exercise initiative show four core sub-competencies: self-awareness, learning from both "failure" and "success" as opportunities to learn and develop. They lead without an official "leader" role or title, motivating others and catalyze necessary action.
ba435d4c-ae8e-41ae-8ef7-198ae98804e1.name: Initiative - Community College of Vermont

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has a strong understanding of initiative and its applications in the workplace.
The recipient of this badge has successfully applied their initiative skills, and the associated sub-competencies in a professional environment.
The recipient of this badge has exhibited their initiative skills through a series of performance-based assessments grounded in workplace scenarios.

3a09a4fc-aecf-4693-a980-9a4ccffc39db.description: Earners of this badge are able to apply their knowledge of payroll operations: preparation of payroll registers, recording of accounting entries, and preparation of payroll tax returns required of businesses. Earners are also introduced to the Fair Labor Standards Act and other relevant laws affecting payroll operations and employment practices today.
3a09a4fc-aecf-4693-a980-9a4ccffc39db.name: Payroll Accounting

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 5 modules. Topics include legal, legislative, and ethical concerns in payroll accounting, gross pay calculations, fringe benefits, withholdings, reporting payroll, and recording and journalizing payroll transactions.
Apply knowledge of payroll accounting concepts through a series of exercises and problems, and a final exam.
Create a payroll journal and payroll register in Excel and generate accounting entries for payroll that accounts for deductions, withholdings, and fringe benefits.

f5450c3a-709f-4033-bcea-681cafe5eda8.description: Earners of the badge are able to think quantitatively and use mathematics as a problem-solving tool in their professional and personal lives. Earners are able to select and perform appropriate procedures to solve mathematical problems arising in a variety of disciplines and contexts and are proficient in interpreting, evaluating and presenting quantitative data and information.
f5450c3a-709f-4033-bcea-681cafe5eda8.name: Applied Math Concepts

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics include the WorkKeys® Applied Math Assessment, a Quantitative Reasoning Assessment (QRA), number theory, linear and nonlinear problem-solving, geometry, statistics, probability, consumer math, and set theory.

Apply knowledge of key math concepts through a series of discussion forums (20% of final grade), weekly problem-solving assignments (20% of final grade), quizzes (30% of final grade), and 3 exams (30% of final grade).

6e1c5f40-ce9e-497e-877c-72377aa65013.description: Earners of this badge are able to apply the knowledge and skills of small business management to make informed business decisions, demonstrated through the creation of a detailed business plan.
6e1c5f40-ce9e-497e-877c-72377aa65013.name: Small Business Management

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics include small business start-up, risk tolerance, assessing personality, ethics in business, assessing and evaluating business ideas, competitive analysis, business mission and strategy, financial health, legal forms of business, human resources, principles of marketing, organizing operations, exit and harvest plans, and franchising or purchasing a business.
Apply key terms and knowledge of small business management through a series of quizzes.

Develop a comprehensive 8+ page business plan that includes the following sections: executive summary, market analysis, company description, organization and management, marketing and sales management, service and product line, funding request, financials, and appendix of additional documents.

cca1f3ac-4c63-433c-b134-c6b7f5fcf4c0.description: Earners of this badge are able to examine critical issues and the strategic questions that must be considered when managing diverse groups of people in today’s workplace.
cca1f3ac-4c63-433c-b134-c6b7f5fcf4c0.name: Human Resource Management

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and discussions in 10 modules. Topics include selecting, training, & evaluating personnel, compensation, health & safety, bargaining units, motivation, morale, and human relations.
Apply knowledge and concepts of human resource management through a series of quizzes and assignments.
Conduct an interview with a professional in the HR field and write an analysis applying the topics discussed during the interview to key terms and concepts learned throughout the course.

314686f4-6163-40f1-8fd8-8d1385cd065c.description: Earners of this badge are able to apply principles and techniques of marketing through the development of a small business marketing plan.
314686f4-6163-40f1-8fd8-8d1385cd065c.name: Small Business Marketing

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics include marketing mix concepts, strategic planning, market research process, STP marketing strategy, product offerings, pricing strategies & decisions, branding, consumer behavior, customer satisfaction & retention, promotion, selling strategies, and ethical considerations in marketing.
Apply knowledge of marketing concepts through a series of quizzes.
Develop a marketing plan for a business or non-profit of interest. Elements of this project include situation analysis, business proposition, strategies and action plan, and evaluation plan.

3743b84c-6284-46a4-9e60-680d1a5717c0.description: Earners of this badge have completed the required addiction and substance use disorder education for the Apprentice Addiction Professional (AAP) certification through the Vermont Office of Professional Regulation. (In addition to 40 education hours, AAP certification requires applicants to be employed within a Preferred Provider Network, have or be working toward an associate or bachelor degree, and meet additional exam, employment, supervision, and minimum age requirements.)
3743b84c-6284-46a4-9e60-680d1a5717c0.name: Addiction: An Introduction to Clinical Skills

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

alignments.name: State of Vermont - Alcohol & Drug Abuse Counselor Forms & Instructions
alignments.description: The AAP certification is required by the Vermont Department of Health’s Division of Alcohol and Drug Abuse Programs (ADAP) for entry-level providers in its Preferred Provider Network. The certification exists only in Vermont.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics include role of AAPs, theories & models of substance use disorders and addiction, stages of change model, utilization of ASAM criteria, client assessment, counseling interventions, consultation, collaboration, referrals, crisis intervention, education of client & others, professional ethics, HIPAA & CFR Part 2, harm reduction, co-occurring disorders, treatment interventions, and challenges of providing treatment.
Apply knowledge of substance use disorder and addiction treatment terms and concepts through a series of quizzes and exams that use case study examples.

ee4a75dd-f60b-4ad2-8896-838de856c5a8.description: Earners of this badge are able to use the scientific method to evaluate well-researched evidence in the area of human biology and have demonstrated a fundamental understanding of the anatomy and physiology of major body systems.
ee4a75dd-f60b-4ad2-8896-838de856c5a8.name: Human Biology

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics include human biology, the scientific method, chemistry of living things, the cell, skeletal system, muscular system, cardiovascular system, immune system, respiratory system, digestive system, nervous system, special senses, endocrine system, urinary system, reproductive system, cell reproduction, differentiation, cancer, inheritance, and biotechnology.
Apply knowledge of human biology through a series of quizzes and exams.

Create a narrated slideshow of a disease. The project includes identification of a disease and the biological systems impacted, description of the symptoms, description of the treatments, and a list of references.

eeb5ad1c-4f7a-46e2-9700-17ab4d47998a.description: Earners of this badge are able to effectively create websites and pages and have a foundational knowledge in the application of website development tools, managing site content, site presentation, and site behaviors. Students will also explore and modify Hypertext Markup Language (HTML), Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), and use Javascript code.
eeb5ad1c-4f7a-46e2-9700-17ab4d47998a.name: Website Development

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics include: website content, style, & functionality, content management systems, legal & ethical considerations in web design, HTML, CSS, website planning, tables & forms, Javascript & PHP, managing data, and cost & logistics of website maintenance.
Utilize knowledge gained through the course to design and build a multi-page website that includes internal navigation, consistent style, and interactive elements.

7bda3ed1-4666-45ea-b39f-90e259db197e.description: Earners of this badge have a foundational knowledge of computer science including hardware, networking, the Internet, programming logic, ethics, and the history and future of the industry.
7bda3ed1-4666-45ea-b39f-90e259db197e.name: Introduction to Computer Science

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 12 modules. Topics include core hardware concepts, peripherals and connectors, computing devices, the Internet of things (IoT), operating systems, software development, database fundamentals, networking concepts and technologies, security concepts and threats, security best practices, business continuity and computer support, and introduction to Python.
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of basic computer science concepts through a series of labs and quizzes.
Using Python, earners will complete a series of assignments that require writing code that works with strings and math, implement variables in code, and write code to create a savings calculator.

fa84ff4e-758f-441d-872d-8c1e496a8e64.description: Earners of this badge are able to describe and discuss data management in the healthcare setting, including the role of health information professionals, technologies used to support health information processes within the revenue cycle, and the importance of accuracy, patience rights, HIPAA and data security. Students explore healthcare delivery systems, including the role of accrediting and regulatory agencies, facility and staff organization, and health record content and management.
fa84ff4e-758f-441d-872d-8c1e496a8e64.name: Introduction to Health Information Systems

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 9 modules. Topics include health care delivery systems, health information management professionals, health care settings, patient care, electronic health records, health care disparities and inequities, health information for quality improvement, legal aspects of health information management, and the balance between business and patient care.
Apply knowledge of health information systems through a series of quizzes and assessments.
Complete case study assignments on the topics of EHR and EMR Systems, REL (Race, Ethnicity, and Language) and patient enrollment data, and the revenue cycle.

8c56b009-8b43-4849-9afb-e10aab281ec4.description: Earners of this badge are able to apply entrepreneurial attitudes, behaviors, and skills required to be drivers of innovation in any organization and/or start a small business through the exploration of a potential business venture.
8c56b009-8b43-4849-9afb-e10aab281ec4.name: Startup 802: An Entrepreneurship Mindset

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 6 modules. Topics include choice and opportunity as an innovator and entrepreneur, actions for success, building a knowledge base, wealth management, building a brand, building community, importance of persistence, presentations and pitches, and SMART Goals.

Create a tradeshow presentation that includes a potential customer survey, flyer/business card sharing information about the company, price list of services/products, and additional visual elements that help to showcase the product.

ce59b594-8a84-4ccb-9e2f-b0a1c7df6300.description: Creative problem-solving in the 21st century workplace includes the capacity to solve problems in new ways. Effective creative problem-solvers exercise four core sub-competencies: both divergent and convergent thinking; identify patterns that may not be obvious; manage ambiguity; and apply an iterative process for generating, testing and refining ideas.
ce59b594-8a84-4ccb-9e2f-b0a1c7df6300.name: Creative Problem Solving - Community College of Vermont

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has a strong understanding of creative problem solving and its applications in the workplace.
The recipient of this badge has successfully applied their creative problem solving skills, and the associated sub-competencies in a professional environment.
The recipient of this badge has exhibited their creative problem solving skills through a series of performance-based assessments grounded in workplace scenarios.

e9cc733a-f476-4a33-a539-33a8e8123090.description: Critical thinking in the 21st century includes the capacity to reason logically and rigorously. Effective critical thinkers exhibit four core sub-competencies: gather and assess relevant information; identify patterns; question assumptions; and draw well-reasoned conclusions.
e9cc733a-f476-4a33-a539-33a8e8123090.name: Critical Thinking - Community College of Vermont

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has a strong understanding of critical thinking and its applications in the workplace.
The recipient of this badge has successfully applied their critical thinking skills, and the associated sub-competencies in a professional environment.
The recipient of this badge has exhibited their critical thinking skills through a series of performance-based assessments grounded in workplace scenarios.

74c8f250-781b-4e3f-ac34-5f8c8fc4ea40.description: Earners of this badge are able to apply the tools, resources, and essential processes necessary to assist job seekers from vulnerable populations including effective discovery and assessment, job development and placement, employer outreach and negotiation, and workplace supports. Earners of this badge will also receive an ACRE (Association of Community Rehabilitation Educators) Certificate of Achievement.
74c8f250-781b-4e3f-ac34-5f8c8fc4ea40.name: Employment Services for Individuals with Disabilities

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 7 modules. Topics fall under the four main domain areas: 1) Application of Core Values and Principles to Practice, 2) Individualized Assessment and Employment/Career Planning, 3) Community Research and Job Development, 4) Workplace and Related Supports. In addition, earners choose one of the following topics: transition-aged youth, mental health or substance abuse, persons with developmental disabilities.
Apply knowledge of employment services through a series of quizzes.
Complete field assignments that apply course concepts to the earner’s individualized work environment.

d4e08f7a-0bdc-4986-bf1d-bf4659aaae74.description: Earners of this badge are able to develop job descriptions and postings, conduct reference checks, create a training & evaluation process for new employees, and discuss some of the legal and ethical issues that affect hiring and performance review.
d4e08f7a-0bdc-4986-bf1d-bf4659aaae74.name: Effective Hiring & Performance Management

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and discussions in 5 modules. Topics include job descriptions, job postings, resumes, interviews, preparing, training, & managing temporary employees, evaluation & feedback process, and legal & ethical issues in the hiring & performance review process.
Apply knowledge and concepts of effective hiring & performance management through a series of quizzes and assignments.
Write a 1-2 page paper on a case study that involves legal and ethical issues in the hiring and performance review process.

62d9a69e-72b5-4592-afa7-11cb1a39a235.description: Earners of this badge are able to set priorities, improve communication effectiveness, build rapport, and handle conflict through better communication inside and outside the group environment.
62d9a69e-72b5-4592-afa7-11cb1a39a235.name: Improving Workplace Communication

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 5 modules. Topics include emotional intelligence (EQ), cognitive dissonance, self-assessment in the context of adverse childhood experiences (ACEs), stress coping mechanisms, working with nonverbals, cognitive bias, organizational communication, the role of attitudes, beliefs, & values in workplace communication, and trust repair.
Apply knowledge of workplace communication strategies through a series of quizzes and a final exam that uses highly relevant scenarios and questions.

b2a1e787-8844-4f2b-8808-327499512e86.description: Earners of this badge are able to use QuickBooks Pro accounting software to set up a new company and chart of accounts; record transactions with customers, vendors and employees; manage lists; run and customize reports; change forms; and generate letters.
b2a1e787-8844-4f2b-8808-327499512e86.name: Fundamentals of QuickBooks

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 5 modules. Topics include new company setup, vendors and inventory, customers and sales, analysis and reports, entering transactions, end of quarter review, report customization, connect to apps, and QuickBooks updates.
Apply knowledge of QuickBooks through a series of quizzes.

7e582c53-eb3d-4210-a1f8-0af487b360a2.description: Earners of this credentials have demonstrated that they possess the entrepreneurial mindset, skills, and knowledge necessary to successfully launch and manage a small business including: developing marketing, financial and sales plans, using effective management and financial strategies, understanding relevant laws and legal structures for entrepreneurs, and analyzing different methods and strategies for initiating, managing, and growing a new business venture.
7e582c53-eb3d-4210-a1f8-0af487b360a2.name: Startup 802: Entrepreneurship

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Startup 802: An Entrepreneurship Mindset
Small Business Marketing
Small Business Management
Fundamentals of QuickBooks
Fundamentals of Selling
Law for Entrepreneurs
Initiating & Managing Entrepreneurial Growth
Finance for Entrepreneurs

Earners of this credential have produced the following projects: virtual tradeshow presentation for a potential business idea, marketing plan for a business or non-profit of interest, comprehensive business plan, and sales plan project.

a93154c0-78d5-49f0-9dd0-09a2c83bc10e.description: Earners of this badge are able to assess their style of conflict management, apply skills required to effectively manage conflict, and proactively implement strategies to avoid potential conflict in the workplace.
a93154c0-78d5-49f0-9dd0-09a2c83bc10e.name: Conflict Management

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and discussions in 5 modules. Topics include conflict management models, levels of conflict, conflict management, conflict resolution, nonverbal communication & the roles of perception, cognition & emotion, empathy, positive reinforcement & leadership, total conflict management, and the physical space in the practice of conflict management.
Apply knowledge and concepts of conflict management through a series of assignments that use highly relevant scenarios and interactive activities.

b1a2c598-7abb-479b-ab70-f404ed0135a8.description: Earners of this badge are able to create meaningful financial statements that communicate important information to those who read them, and are introduced to problems of external reporting as they relate to service providers, merchandisers, and corporations.
b1a2c598-7abb-479b-ab70-f404ed0135a8.name: Financial Accounting

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 18 modules. Topics include ethics, career opportunities, accounting equation, analyzing and journaling transactions, adjusting process, accounting cycle, accounting systems, accounting for merchandising businesses, inventories, internal control and cash, receivables, long-term assets (fixed and intangible), current liabilities and payroll, accounting for partnerships, LLCs, corporations and dividends, statement of cash flows, and financial statement analysis.
Apply knowledge of financial accounting concepts through a series of quizzes.

Complete case study assignments that require the earner to apply course concepts to real-world scenarios. Topics include completing the accounting cycle, journalizing transactions, transferring information to the general ledger, and measures of liquidity, solvency, and profitability.

d8acab3b-9360-4720-9a07-c9a85fa1f2bd.description: Earners of the badge are able to apply the basics of business law required of an entrepreneur and related to their unique business venture.
d8acab3b-9360-4720-9a07-c9a85fa1f2bd.name: Law for Entrepreneurs

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 6 modules. Topics include the relationship between business law and entrepreneurship, business entities, intellectual property, contracts, taxes and the entrepreneur, and common entrepreneurial mistakes.
Apply key terms and knowledge of business law through quizzes and assignments.

ba49168e-3a74-4995-b72a-3f89c4a5137f.description: Earners of this badge are able to successfully navigate a variety of office application software for computers and mobile devices, including cloud applications, presentations, word processing, and spreadsheets.
ba49168e-3a74-4995-b72a-3f89c4a5137f.name: Computer Applications

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Module topics include cloud computing, malware, spyware, phishing, word processing, copyright and research papers, advanced formatting in Word (drawing, tables, and tools), mail merge, presentations and slide shows, spreadsheets (setup, calculations, managing data, charts, graphs), and computing ethics.
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of computer applications through a series of quizzes.

Complete a research project and presentation about a computer ethics topic of choice. The project includes slides covering the chosen topic using a variety of communication methods (images, videos, shapes, etc.) to effectively communicate information, a recorded audio track of the presentation, side transitions, animation, and citations.

7012fca3-9b4d-4609-8c14-0b21e0de0191.description: Earners of this badge are able to: define and discuss key security concepts and components of information systems, examine the issues of online threats, and explore personal and professional strategies to reduce vulnerabilities.
7012fca3-9b4d-4609-8c14-0b21e0de0191.name: Foundations of Information Security

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 5 modules. Topics include history and concepts of information security, cyberthreats, privacy policies, and protecting personal information.
Apply knowledge of information security concepts through a series of quizzes.
Develop a 3-5 page plan to ensure the safety of online personal information. This includes identifying strategies to protect information as well as approaches to maintaining the components.

0a943a8b-4d61-492c-9f49-284f40afce0e.description: Earners of this badge have a solid understanding of the characteristics, organization, and operation of a business, including organization and management, production planning and control, marketing, finance, day-to-day operations in the areas of accounting, personnel, research and development, and management information systems.
0a943a8b-4d61-492c-9f49-284f40afce0e.name: Introduction to Business

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Module topics include economic systems, business ethics, global marketplace, forms of business ownership, entrepreneurship, Small Business Administration, business management, business structure, careers in business, production and operations management, marketing, technology in business, and money and financial reporting.
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of business concepts through a series of quizzes.

Develop an 8+ page business plan for a publicly-traded company of choice. The plan must include the following sections: an executive summary, market analysis, company description, organization and management, marketing and sales management, service and product line, financials, and appendix.

a80e2798-63b9-41c6-987e-5542613be799.description: Earners of this badge understand the legal procedures for recruiting, hiring, training, evaluating, promoting, and dismissing employees. They are able to analyze significant federal and state employment laws, evaluate organizational compliance, discuss the impact of non-compliance, and demonstrate familiarity with tools and resources to maintain current knowledge and monitor changes in employment law.
a80e2798-63b9-41c6-987e-5542613be799.name: Employment Law

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and discussions in 10 modules. Topics include employees vs. Independent contractors, employment contracts, arbitration agreements, & at-will employment, employment laws & current trends, discrimination, sexual harassment, compliance in job ads, hiring practices, & training procedures, compliance in evaluating, rewarding, disciplining, & terminating employees, monitoring changes in employment law, and the impact of non-compliance.
Apply knowledge and concepts of employment law through a series of quizzes and assignments.
Write a 6-8 page paper exploring a current issue in employment law and a proposed resolution.

94de7aa4-5527-4420-a54d-246d7dd17793.description: Earners of this badge are able to discuss and apply the basic financial strategies, concepts, and tools used by entrepreneurs.
94de7aa4-5527-4420-a54d-246d7dd17793.name: Finance for Entrepreneurs

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 5 modules. Topics include finding funding sources, creating a budget, financial statements, finding investors, and strategic planning.
Apply key terms and knowledge of finance to a series of quizzes and assignments.

a845f345-0b34-4d33-aa49-32617a4d8a44.description: Earners of this badge are able to analyze complicated medical claims to ensure proper reimbursement, identify the procedure for two or more party billing, apply medical insurance vocabulary, demonstrate proper use of coding manuals, identify methods for addressing common issues (medical necessity, claim denial and appeal, bundling, and charge capture), and demonstrate the ability to accurately follow procedures, fill out common forms, and address common issues to maximize reimbursement.
a845f345-0b34-4d33-aa49-32617a4d8a44.name: Health Insurance Reimbursement & Billing

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 7 modules. Topics include introduction to health insurance, private insurance and government plans (BCBS, Medicare, Medicaid, Tricare), insurance laws and regulations, claim development, revenue life cycle, medical coding, reimbursement methodologies, and claim form submersion.
Apply knowledge of health insurance reimbursement and billing concepts through a series of quizzes.

Complete assignments that provide practical experience in the field including working with the encounter form/superbill, calculating reimbursements and write-offs, processing different types of complex claims (commercial, Medicare, Medicaid, Tricare, Workers Compensation), appealing a denied medical claim, and identifying codes.

68e785a6-577a-44f4-a88c-16ebaaa802c6.description: Earners of this badge are able to install, configure, and troubleshoot the Microsoft Windows operating systems.
68e785a6-577a-44f4-a88c-16ebaaa802c6.name: Desktop Operating Systems

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 14 modules. Topics include Windows Operating system, installing and configuring a device, networking and basic security, virtual memory, the registry, disk management, boot process, diagnostics and troubleshooting, updates and preventative maintenance, optimization, PowerShell and automation, backups and encryption, and virtualization and cloud computing.
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of desktop operating systems through a series of quizzes.
Create a how-to article or presentation to accomplish an operational task in Windows 10. Example topics include configuring a device, installing software, and setting up the firewall.

9386d5d9-b4d3-4720-aa87-f6ca0da8a5f7.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated a comprehensive understanding of the core concepts of digital marketing. Earners are able to apply the techniques of internet marketing, create and manage effective websites and pages, demonstrate competency in web analytic techniques and practices, and create an effective search engine marketing campaign to achieve promotional goals.
9386d5d9-b4d3-4720-aa87-f6ca0da8a5f7.name: Digital Marketing

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Introduction to Digital Marketing
Website Development
Introduction to Web Analytics
Search Engine Marketing & Optimization

Earners of this credential have produced the following projects: original digital marketing plan, multi-page website including internal navigation, consistent style, & interactive elements, analysis of a self-designed web campaign, SEO plan, and PPC campaign.

43370533-d268-4b16-a556-eedb9b85a671.description: Earners of this badge are able to examine and design strategic compensation and benefits structures that meet organizational goals and increase efficacy through employee recruitment, engagement, and retention.
43370533-d268-4b16-a556-eedb9b85a671.name: Employment Compensation & Benefits

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and discussions in 11 modules. Topics include types of workers, legal implications of employees vs. independent contractors, calculating total cost of workforce, job analysis, job description, job evaluation, compensation analysis, internal & external pay equity, mandatory benefits, voluntary benefits & work perks, factors affecting employee recruitment & retention, demographic & industry changes impacting workforce, and national & state compensation laws.
Apply knowledge and concepts of employment compensation and benefits through a series of quizzes and assignments.
Develop a set of compensation packages for varied employees in an organization that includes salary/wages, mandatory benefits, voluntary benefits, and work perks.

fb9a436d-7609-4b40-ad5a-00444c6d8155.description: Earners of this badge are able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills required for sales and product promotion through the creation of an original sales plan.
fb9a436d-7609-4b40-ad5a-00444c6d8155.name: Fundamentals of Selling

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 7 modules. Topics include understanding of professional sales, processes and methodologies, targeting and prospecting, developing a sales story, sales calls and the presentation of sales data, and planning.
Apply key terms and knowledge of selling through a series of quizzes and sales scenarios.

Create a sales plan project that includes 7 sections: target customer, defined value proposition, prospects, sales story, sales call outline, sales presentation and tracking, assessment, and adjustment.

f465b42b-6633-492c-8b91-28935250a784.description: Earners of this badge are able to analyze and apply different methods and strategies for initiating, managing, and growing a new business venture.
f465b42b-6633-492c-8b91-28935250a784.name: Initiating & Managing Entrepreneurial Growth

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 5 modules. Topics include the challenges and opportunities of growing a business, key resources, competitive advantage, phases of growth, and management strategies.
Apply key terms and knowledge of growth management strategies to assignments that use real-world scenarios.

50971f3b-53c5-4f5c-b0fe-3ebdb94e67a9.description: Earners of this badge are able to apply knowledge of diagnostic approaches, techniques, and practices of web analytics used to achieve greater return on investment through online marketing initiatives by drawing from case studies and practical application. Topics covered include technologies such as ad-servers, rich media, bid-management systems, and online research tools with an emphasis on tracking and reporting of web site activity and campaign measurement and testing.
50971f3b-53c5-4f5c-b0fe-3ebdb94e67a9.name: Introduction to Web Analytics

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics include analytics & the 4 Ps of marketing (product, place, promotion, price), web metrics & business goals, web performance metrics, differences between B2C and B2B objectives, web analytics & KPI, Google Analytics, analyzing web data, Google Adwords, SEO & PPC data analysis, email marketing data, and social media data.
Apply knowledge of web analytics terms and concepts through a series of quizzes.

Write a report that analyzes the data collected in a web campaign project. This includes an analysis of web data (overviews on audience, acquisition, & behavior), email data summary, social media data summary, and an overall reflection on the web campaign that examines the relationships between sets of data and provides suggestions for improvement.

a17ad19e-1f58-4d8d-afa7-32dd6e384999.description: Earners of this badge are able to utilize the technologies, techniques, and strategies required to achieve high rankings on search engines and create an effective search engine marketing campaign to achieve promotional goals. Topics include organic search engine optimization practices, pay-per-click approaches, information architecture and navigation, content structure, and internal page and link strategy.
a17ad19e-1f58-4d8d-afa7-32dd6e384999.name: Search Engine Marketing & Optimization

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 14 modules. Topics include uses and application of SEO & SEM, search engine differences & uses, keywords, SEO best practices, link building best practice, role of social media in SEO & SEM, analytics for measuring SEO & SEM, SEO troubleshooting, local SEO strategies, SEO tools, components of PPC campaign, and SEO/SEM careers.
Apply knowledge of SEO and SEM terms and concepts through a series of quizzes.

Utilize knowledge gained through the course to develop an SEO plan for a business based on best practices. Elements include an introduction, keyword research, on-page SEO plan, link-building plan, social media plan, analytics plan, local SEO plan, and SEO audit.
Utilize knowledge gained through the course to develop two PPC campaigns based on best practices. Elements include at least 3 ad group/keywords, 3 ad variations, and budgeting.

15d4c2a5-17bd-4e9b-9a77-c7c2ec6fa13b.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated an understanding of accounting principles and practices, banking, and analysis and reporting of financial data through a variety of assignments and projects based on real-word scenarios.
15d4c2a5-17bd-4e9b-9a77-c7c2ec6fa13b.name: Bookkeeping

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Spreadsheets
Computerized Accounting
Payroll Accounting
Financial Accounting

Earners of this credential have produced the following projects: manipulated and displayed a variety of data through spreadsheets, completed case study assignments on real-world financial accounting topics, completed a bookkeeping project utilizing a computerized accounting system, and created a payroll journal and payroll register in Excel, and generated accounting entries for payroll that accounts for deductions, withholdings, and fringe benefits.

e9b8434f-870b-4404-a077-baacf8d70b71.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated a comprehensive understanding of the core concepts in the human resources field today. Earners are able to design effective hiring processes and performance reviews, apply different conflict management styles, develop strategies to improve workplace communication, build compensation and benefit structures, and maintain current knowledge about federal and state employment laws.
e9b8434f-870b-4404-a077-baacf8d70b71.name: Human Resource Specialist

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Human Resource Management
Improving Workplace Communication
Conflict Management
Effective Hiring & Performance Management
Employment Compensation & Benefits
Employment Law

Earners of this credential have produced the following projects: an interview with a professional in the HR field & written analysis discussing key terms and concepts, design of an interview & performance process, creation of a compensation package plan using information from a sample scenario, and a 6-8 page paper exploring a current issue in employment law and a proposed resolution.

cd785101-155d-47a0-a7c4-35e15ec9742d.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated a comprehensive understanding of the core concepts of medical billing and coding. They are able to employ knowledge of medical terminology, health information systems, and medical coding, billing, and insurance reimbursement practices to effectively impact the healthcare revenue cycle.
cd785101-155d-47a0-a7c4-35e15ec9742d.name: Medical Billing & Coding

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Medical Terminology
Introduction to Health Information Systems
Health Insurance Reimbursement & Billing
Medical Coding I

Demonstrate the use of medical terms in context. Complete case study assignments on the topics of EHR and EMR Systems, REL and patient enrollment data, and the revenue cycle. Complete assignments that provide practical experience in the field including working with the encounter form/superbill, calculating reimbursements and write-offs, processing diverse types of complex claims, appealing a denied medical claim, and identifying codes.

7d0b3343-da4d-4903-bb5f-d839feeb77c2.description: Earners of this badge have developed introductory skills in digital image manipulation, digital illustration, and page layout.
7d0b3343-da4d-4903-bb5f-d839feeb77c2.name: Adobe Creative Cloud

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings, tutorials, and assignments in 15 modules. Module topics include Photoshop: restoration, manipulation, channels, selection tools, layer masks, clipping masks, blending modes, and layer styles. Illustrator: pen tool, anchor points, benzir curves. Typography: expressive typography. InDesign: typography, effects, type crimes.
Create a sample 2-page magazine spread featuring the following: text elements, images, article, cover, and back cover ad.

747967cc-788f-461d-afb1-1bea360b475e.description: Earners of this badge are able to apply their knowledge of basic networking concepts through the design of a comprehensive network proposal. Concepts include network operating systems, hardware, and troubleshooting techniques and the role, setup, and administration of Local Area Networks (LAN).
747967cc-788f-461d-afb1-1bea360b475e.name: Concepts of Local Area Networks

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics include network models and cabling, ethernet, installing a physical network, TCP/IP basics and applications, routing, network naming, advanced networking devices, IPv6, wireless networking, building a network, managing risk, network security and troubleshooting.
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of local area networks through a series of labs, quizzes, and a final exam.

Design a network proposal for a new business. This proposal will include an identification of requirements (including anticipated future needs), network devices, adding IPs, basic routing, DNS naming, VLANs, IPv6, failure planning, security, and rationale. Once the proposal is complete, earners will develop a presentation that will outline all of the key aspects for the customer.

ad8900be-a99d-4e91-a69e-95f107fc9b99.description: Earners of this credential have a basic cybersecurity skillset, knowledge of the foundations of computer science, and are able to identify threats to personal information security and prepare a plan for implementing a cybersecurity solution in a professional setting.
ad8900be-a99d-4e91-a69e-95f107fc9b99.name: Cybersecurity

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Introduction to Computer Science
Foundations of Information Security
Principles & Management of Cybersecurity
Desktop Operating Systems
Concepts of Local Area Networks

Earners of this credential have produced the following projects: completed a Python coding project, created an online personal information safety plan, developed a security management analysis and report on a case study, created an instructional article or presentation on how to accomplish a task in Windows 10, and designed a comprehensive network proposal for a new business.

f4e4afdf-4f6f-4d95-8cd2-9c62d446db3e.description: This badge recognizes successful completion of the course Dismantling Systems, Transforming Lives: Foundations of Equity & Inclusion. Earners explored the effects of systems of oppression, power, and privilege; they considered individual strategies to dismantle and transform these systems and discovered ways to build and maintain an inclusive ecosystem.
f4e4afdf-4f6f-4d95-8cd2-9c62d446db3e.name: Foundations of Equity & Inclusion

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete reflective journal assignments and participate in discussions.
Create a final project that includes a reflective component and a plan for facilitating transformative action.

8eacc78c-2763-4635-bc06-c50a674641c9.description: Earners of this badge are able to discuss a broad range of concepts involved in protecting information assets within computer systems and networks and develop strategies for identifying and remediating personal and physical vulnerabilities based on the CIA Triangle security model (confidentiality, integrity, and availability).
8eacc78c-2763-4635-bc06-c50a674641c9.name: Principles & Management of Cybersecurity

issuer.summary: issued by Community College of Vermont

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and assignments in 15 modules. Topics include the CIA Triad model, evaluating security threats, identification, authentication, authorization, access control, auditing, accountability, cryptography, compliance, laws, regulations, operations security, human errors, physical security, business continuity, network security, operating system security, mobile & IoT security, and application security.
Demonstrate knowledge of the principles and management of cybersecurity through a series of quizzes and exams.

Develop an analysis and report for a given scenario that includes the following elements: security & budget planning, security policy, risk & impact analysis, and developing a security awareness and education plan.
